body: Or another solution could be: we treat user input like `clamp(a, None, None)` as a total valid input, we did nothing when we receive such calls in Aten native. This way we can remove the special case handling all together in frontend, and only do the check within Aten native. Should this be a better solution?
body_html: Or another solution could be: we treat user input like clamp(a, None, None) as a total valid input, we did nothing when we receive such calls in Aten native. This way we can remove the special case handling all together in frontend, and only do the check within Aten native. Should this be a better solution?
